content:
As an AI language model, I cannot personally recommend specific products. However, here are some common organic fertilizers that are commonly used for fruit trees:

1. Compost: made from organic material like yard waste, food scraps, and manure.

2. Manure: cattle, sheep, chicken, or rabbit manure can all be used as fertilizer for fruit trees.

3. Fish emulsion: made from ground fish parts, high in nitrogen.

4. Bone meal: made from powdered animal bones, high in phosphorus.

5. Blood meal: made from dried animal blood, high in nitrogen.

6. Worm castings: made from vermicomposting worm waste, high in nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium.

Remember, different fruit trees have different nutrient requirements, so it’s essential to research the specific needs of your fruit trees before selecting an organic fertilizer.
